input: Unlike most of the other U.S.-based asset managers we cover, we are projecting an improvement (albeit a slight one) in operating margins for BlackRock over the next five years, with the firm's margins expected to average 40%-41% on an adjusted basis (compared with 38%-39% during the past five calendar years). As such, the firm should be able to generate close to $7.0 billion in free cash flow on average annually during 2021-25, much of which will be returned to shareholders as dividends and share repurchases.
